post.description:
This API allows to create an admin account ( Linux or Windows ). Once this api consumed, a mail is sent to the standard user associated to the admin account

What input parameters this API needs ?

Body parameters:

  • standard_user [Required] : login of the stardard user. For example use dupontj1 to create admin account dupontj1a.

  • type [Required] : target type of Operating system . can only be ['linux','windows']

What actions this API do?

For WINDOWS account:

  • Create Admin account in Active directory

  • Send Admin account information to the user by email

  • set extensionattribute14 of standard login

For LINUX account:

  • Create Admin account in LDAP

  • Send Admin account information to the user by email

  • set extensionattribute13 of standard login

What information this API returns ?

Returned information is :

  • User is created and account information sent to user by email

Only GTS member can consume this API.

This API allows to reset an admin account password ( Linux or Windows ). Once this api consumed, a mail is sent to the standard user associated to the admin account

What input parameters this API needs ?

Body parameters:

  • standard_user [Required] : login of the stardard user. For example use dupontj1 to reset password of admin account dupontj1a.

  • type [Required] : target type of Operating system . can only be ['linux','windows']

What actions this API do?

For both WINDOWS and LINUX accounts:

  • Reset admin acoount password by setting a new generated one

  • Send Admin account information to the user by email

What information this API returns ?

Returned information is :

  • User password has been reset

Only GTS member can consume this API.

This API return member names in current blacklist

What input parameters this API needs ?

No input parameters required.

What information this API returns ?

In case of success, the returned information is :

{
  "group_members": {
    "name": "BEAPI-BLACKLIST-ENV-GRP",
    "member": [
      "BEAPI-BLACKLIST-ENV-IP000",
      "BEAPI-BLACKLIST-ENV-IP001",
      "BEAPI-BLACKLIST-ENV-IP002"
    ]
  }
}

where BEAPI-BLACKLIST-ENV-GRP is the firewall address group object and BEAPI-BLACKLIST-ENV-IPXXX are members in this group.

ACL Filtered

get.description:
List Java JDK installed on a Linux Host.

This API list Open JDK on a server under a specific applicative user.

What input parameters this API needs ?

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the asset is located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API.

hostname [Required]

Target server hostname without domain

version [Required]

Version of java to install . OpenJDK version : 8 or 11 or 17 or 21

appuser [Required]

Applicative user account on which list java libraries on the remote server. Thsi application user account must have been created on the target server before using this api.

What this api does ?

Using information needed bellow, this api will list openJDK version on the targer host:

Installation Folder :

/opt/<appuser>/java/
   latest -> /opt/<appuser>/java/
   OpenJDK11U-jdk_x64_linux_hotspot_11.0.4_11
   OpenJDK8U-jdk_x64_linux_hotspot_8u212b04

What information this API returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this API will return a job ID

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs API.

post.description:
Install Tomcat a Linux Host.

This API allows to install Tomcat on a server under a specific applicative user.

What input parameters this API needs ?

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the asset is located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API.

hostname [Required]

Target server hostname without domain

appuser [Required]

Applicative user account on which install java on the remote server. Thsi application user account must have been created on the remote server before using this api.

instancename [Required]

Name of tomcat instance. By default : tomcat1 . Should be unique on the same server.

Allowed pattern : ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$

httpport [Required]

Port on which Tomcat will be bind. By default : 8080. Make sure to choose a port that is available ( not already used ) on the target server.

tomcatversion [Required]

Version of tomcat to install . Tomcat version : 8, 9 or 10

Soon: an API will list with tomcat version you can install

javainstall [Required]

Install java with tomcat ? Default : yes. - Select yes if no java is already installed under applicative user account. - Select no if a java version is already installed under applicative user account in /opt/appuser/java/latest

javaversion [Required]

Version of java to install . OpenJDK version : 8, 11 or 17 or 21

What this api does ?

Tomcat will be deployed on the target machine with the latest version of OpenJDK (The OpenSource version of Java, as Oracle is now charging licences fees for its versions).

Tomcat instance :

  • Location: /opt/appuser/tomcat/appuser_instancename
  • Permissions: Appuser has full privileges and can control the instance using sudo systemctl start/stop/reload/restart appuser_instancename

Java OpenJDK :

  • Deployed under /opt/appuser/java/latest
  • All permissions granted to appuser account.

What information this API returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this API will return a job ID

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs API.

This API allows to install UC4 client on a server.

What input parameters this API needs ?

Request parameters:

  • trigram: the application trigram

  • env: the environment name

  • hostname: the hostname without domain

Body parameters:

  • version: the version to install

    UC4 client available versions:

  • Linux: [12, 12.3.5]
  • Windows: [12, 12.3.5]

  • agentName: the agent name to register (required for windows) The most often, the agent name is the hostname in upper case (the uppercase is forced)

  • entity: the entity of the host (required for windows) It can be "SGBT"|"SGL"|"GTS".

Specific information

For Linux

  • Compatibility : Only 64bits OS. Job will not run on 32bits.
  • If UC4 is already installed, the config file will not be overwritten.
  • The UC4 agent can be managed by app user sgbt_uc4 using : sudo systemctl start/stop/restart/status uc4v12
  • The access to the server and sgbt_uc4 user is automatically granted to ITEC_UC4

What information this API returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this API will return a job ID

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs API.

post.description:
Add Monitoring of a MQ.

This api allows you to monitor the state of a MQ queue on Linux and raise an alert when its state in not listen.
The monitoring will be added on LMQSLUN-VIP if noprod or on LMSQLUP-VIP if prod

What input parameters this api needs?

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential.

context [Required]

Context noprod or prod.

queue name [Required]

The name of the queue to monitor.

queue manager [Required]

Manager of the queue (example: LUMUTUP1).

alert1 condition time [Required]

This is the condition that will trigger the alert 1. Time lapse (in seconds): if the oldest message in queue is older than this time lapse, the alert is triggered Note: the value must be greater than 120 seconds (and lesser than 86400s = 24h) Example: 120

alert1 severity [Required]

The severity of the alert can be HIGH, WARNING or DISASTER.

  • WARNING and HIGH severity: an Service Now ticket is created if a rule is correctly setup in Bemportal
  • DISASTER severity: Bangalore Call center will phone to the on duty person/team declare in ICLT

alert1 instruction [Optional]

File name link to the document containing instruction to apply in case of alert.
Instructions are stored in synapes: ( https://synapses.fr.world.socgen/share/Team/ITEC_PRD_SGBT/Finalized%20Zabbix/ ).
Instruction must matching a filename pattern (Regexp ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+\.[A-Za-z]{3}$).

alert2 condition periodT [Required]

Period T (in seconds): if the number of current messages in queue is greater than 0 during a period T, the alert is triggered
Note: the value must be greater than 120 seconds
Example: 120

alert2 queue depth [Required]

Maximum messages number (queue depth) of the local queue
Note: the value must be > 100 and < 50000
Example: 5000

alert2 condition percent [Required]

This is the condition that will trigger the alert 3.
Queue depth of local qeue percentage: if the current messages number in the local queue is greater than this percentage, the alert is triggered (Optional)
Note: the value must be > 0 and < 100
Example: 80

alert2 severity [Required]

The severity of the alert can be HIGH, WARNING or DISASTER.

  • WARNING and HIGH severity: an Service Now ticket is created if a rule is correctly setup in Bemportal
  • DISASTER severity: Bangalore Call center will phone to the on duty person/team declare in ICLT

alert2 instruction [Optional]

File name link to the document containing instruction to apply in case of alert.
Instructions are stored in synapes: ( https://synapses.fr.world.socgen/share/Team/ITEC_PRD_SGBT/Finalized%20Zabbix/ ).
Instruction must matching a filename pattern (Regexp ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+\.[A-Za-z]{3}$).

alert3 condition periodT [Required]

This is the condition that will trigger the alert 4.
Period T(in seconds): if the number of messages in backout queue is greater than 0 during a period T, the alert is triggered
Note: the value must be greater than 120 seconds
Example: 120

alert3 severity [Required]

The severity of the alert can be HIGH, WARNING or DISASTER.

  • WARNING and HIGH severity: an Service Now ticket is created if a rule is correctly setup in Bemportal
  • DISASTER severity: Bangalore Call center will phone to the on duty person/team declare in ICLT

alert3 instruction [Optional]

File name link to the document containing instruction to apply in case of alert.
Instructions are stored in synapes: ( https://synapses.fr.world.socgen/share/Team/ITEC_PRD_SGBT/Finalized%20Zabbix/ ).
Instruction must matching a filename pattern (Regexp ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+\.[A-Za-z]{3}$).

Note: The backout queue name will be the local queue name + ".BCK"

What this api does?

This api set 3 or 4 alerts on a queue and its backout queue:

  • ALERT 1: test of the date of older message in queue
  • ALERT 2: test of the current message number > % of queue depth
  • ALERT 3: test of the current message number of the backout queue > 0


Using information needed bellow, this api will create in monitoring tool:

  • item: an item will be created on the specific host and will be formatted as: APP:trigram - item name

    • alert 1 item: APP:trigram - Date of older message in queue queue name:queue manager
    • alert 2 item: APP:trigram - Number of .BCKsages in backout queue of _queue name queue name.BCK:queue manager
    • alert 3 item: APP:trigram - Number of messages in local queue queue name:queue manager

  • trigger: an trigger will be created based in this item and the condition: it will be formatted as: HOST.NAME}: [APP:trigram] - alert name

    • alert 1 trigger: {HOST.NAME}: [APP:trigram] - Date of older message in queue queue name:queue manager > 120
    • alert 2 trigger: Number of messages in_percent_al queue q_queue depth_ame:queue manager > percent% of max msg length (queue depth)
    • alert 3 trigger: {HOST.NAME}: [APP:trigram] - Number of messages in backout queue of queue name queue name.BCK:queue manager > 0

Note

When created , triggers are in Maintenance mode: you will have to remove this maintenance using zbx-portal site.

What information this api returns?

In case of success, the returned information is:

{
  "message": "Monitoring created",
  "item": "<item_id>"
}

post.description:
Add Monitoring of a Filesystem on a Host.

This api allows you to monitor a specific filesystem on a Linux or Windows machine and raise an alert depending its percentage of usage.

What input parameters this api needs ?

hostname [Required]

Hostname as defined in zabbix ( uppercase without domain name : LEXP603 )

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the asset is located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API.

filesystem [Required]

This is the filesystem that will be monitored. Alerts will be triggered on this filesystem depending on the threshold set after. The filesystem to monitor could be Windows or Linux. Depending on the platform you will have to adapt your pattern. For example : Windows host filesystem will be accepted as : "d:" or "D:" and Linux pattern would be "/opt"

warning [Required]

The condition to raise an "WARNING" alert : it's the combination of a comparator ( <, <= , = , >, >= ,<> ) and a integer corresponding to the percentage of usage from the filesystem.

For example , to raise an alert if a filesystem is used for more than 80% the pattern would be : ">80"

high [Required]

The condition to raise an "HIGH" alert : it's the combination of a comparator ( <, <= , = , >, >= ,<> ) and a integer corresponding to the percentage of usage from the filesystem.

For example , to raise an alert if a filesystem is used for more than 90% the pattern would be : ">90"

disaster [Optional]

The condition to raise an "DISASTER" alert : it's the combination of a comparator ( <, <= , = , >, >= ,<> ) and a integer corresponding to the percentage of usage from the filesystem. This parameter is optional.

For example , to raise an alert if a filesystem is used for more than 95% the pattern would be : ">95"

instruction [Optional]

File name link to the document containing instruction to apply in case of alert .

Instructions are stored in synapes : (https://synapses.fr.world.socgen/share/Team/ITEC_PRD_SGBT/Finalized%20Zabbix/ )

Instruction must matching a filename pattern (Regexp ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+\.[A-Za-z]{3}$)

What this api does ?

Using information needed bellow, this api will create in monitoring tool :

  • item : an item will be created on the specific host and will be formatted as : [trigram] - Filesystem filesystem size used. (for example : [PFOLU] - Filesystem /opt size used)

  • trigger : Two triggers will be created based in this item and the warning and high condition. Additionally if you specified a disaster condition, it will also be create : it will be formatted as :

    • alert message for : [APP:trigram] - Filesystem process condition . (for example : [APP:PFOLU] - Filesystem /var space used is >80%

Note

When created , triggers are in Maintenance mode: you will have to remove this maintenance using zbx-portal site.

What information this api returns ?

In case of success, the returned information is :

{ "itemid": "itemid number" }

post.description:
Add Monitoring of a Port on a Host.

This api allows you to monitor the state of a listening port on both Linux and Windows OS and raise an alert when its state in not listen.

What input parameters this api needs ?

hostname [Required]

Hostname as defined in zabbix ( uppercase without domain name : LEXP603 )

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the asset is located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API.

port [Required]

Typically, the port number to monitor.

It's an integer value . ( for example for http process , the value of port is 80 )

If the port is not present on the server or is not listening, an alert is raised

severity [Required]

The severity can be WARNING, HIGH or DISASTER.

  • WARNING and HIGH severity : an Service Now ticket is created if a rule is correctly setup in Bemportal

  • DISASTER severity : Bangalore Call center will phone to the on duty person/team declare in ICLT

alertmessage [Optional]

This option allow to overwrite the default alert message by a custom one

This custom message must not contian spcial character and must contain from be 10 to 50 characters long

For example, a specific applicative message can be set : Kondor application is down or Service IDM is down.

instruction [Optional]

File name link to the document containing instruction to apply in case of alert .

Instructions are stored in synapes : (https://synapses.fr.world.socgen/share/Team/ITEC_PRD_SGBT/Finalized%20Zabbix/ )

Instruction must matching a filename pattern (Regexp ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+\.[A-Za-z]{3}$)

What this api does ?

Using information needed bellow, this api will create in monitoring tool :

  • item : an item will be created on the specific host and will be formatted as : [trigram] - number of process process. (for example : [PFOLU] - port listen on 80)

  • trigger : an trigger will be created based in this item and the condition : it will be formatted as :

    • default alert message : [APP:trigram] - port port is not in listen state . (for example : [APP:PFOLU] - port 80 is not in listen state

    • custom alert message : [APP:trigram] - alertmessage . (for example : [APP:PFOLU] - PFO Application is not available

Note

When created , triggers are in Maintenance mode: you will have to remove this maintenance using zbx-portal site.

What information this api returns ?

In case of success, the returned information is :

{
  "message": "Monitoring created",
  "itemid": "338072"
}

item id corresponding to the monitored process. This information can be retrieved using ZbxPortal Site, Report -> Host PDF

As example, in the report you must get a line like : 130123 ZabAgent [PFOLU] - port 80 is not in listen state

  • trigger : the associated trigger (for example : [APP:PFOLU] - port 80 is not in listen state).

Note

When deleted, the activity history is also purged.

post.description:

What input parameters this api needs ?

hostname [Required]

trigram [Required]

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the asset is located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API.

process [Required]

Typically, count the number of a spectific process.

To specify the linux process, use a string process filter corresponding to the complete unix command used to run this process

A easy way to make this string accurate enough is to use the unix command : ps -efla | grep 'your_string' | grep -v grep.

condition [Required]

The condition to raise an alert : it's the combination of a comparator ( <, <= , = , >, >= ,<> ) and a integer corresponding to number of running processes

For example , to raise an alert if a process is down or not running, use this condition : <1 or =0.

severity [Required]

The severity can be WARNING, HIGH or DISASTER.

  • WARNING and HIGH severity : an Service Now ticket is created if a rule is correctly setup in Bemportal

  • DISASTER severity : Bangalore Call center will phone to the on duty person/team declare in ICLT

alertmessage [Optional]

This option allow to overwrite the default alert message by a custom one

This custom message must not contian spcial character and must contain from be 10 to 50 characters long

For example, a specific applicative message can be set : Kondor application is down or Service IDM is down.

instruction [Optional]

File name link to the document containing instruction to apply in case of alert .

Instructions are stored in synapes : (https://synapses.fr.world.socgen/share/Team/ITEC_PRD_SGBT/Finalized%20Zabbix/ )

Instruction must matching a filename pattern (Regexp ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+\.[A-Za-z]{3}$)

What this api does ?

Using information needed bellow, this api will create in monitoring tool :

  • item : an item will be created on the specific host and will be formatted as : [trigram] - number of process process. (for example : [PFOLU] - number of process tomcat)

  • trigger : an trigger will be created based in this item and the condition : it will be formatted as :

    • default alert message : [APP:trigram] - number of process process condition . (for example : [APP:PFOLU] - number of process tomcat <1

    • custom alert message : [APP:trigram] - alertmessage . (for example : [APP:PFOLU] - PFO Application is not available

Note

When created , triggers are in Maintenance mode: you will have to remove this maintenance using zbx-portal site.

What information this api returns ?

In case of success, the returned information is :

{ "message": "Monitoring Process correctly created" }

instruction [Optional]

Instructions are stored in synapes : (https://synapses.fr.world.socgen/share/Team/ITEC_PRD_SGBT/Finalized%20Zabbix/ )

Instruction must matching a filename pattern (Regexp ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+\.[A-Za-z]{3}$)

What this api does ?

Using information needed bellow, this api will create in monitoring tool :

  • item : an item will be created on the specific host and will be formatted as : [trigram] - name

  • trigger : an trigger will be created based in this item and the condition : it will be formatted as :

    • STD alert message : [APP:trigram] - MQSeries name dequeue rate condition .

    • BK alert message : [APP:trigram] - MQSeries name queue length condition .

    • custom alert message : [APP:trigram] - alertmessage

Note

When created , triggers are in Maintenance mode: you will have to remove this maintenance using zbx-portal site.

What information this api returns ?

In case of success, the returned information is :

{
  "message": "Monitoring created",
  "itemid": "338072"
}

get.description:
Show all service items of a host

This API allows you to show all the service items of a host in the monitoring.

What input parameters this API needs ?

Resource parameters:

  • trigram: the trigram

  • env: the environment

  • hostname: the hostname without domain

post.description:
Add Monitoring of a Service on a Windows Host

This api allows you to monitor a specific service on host Windows machine and raise an alert depending its state.

What input parameters this api needs ?

hostname [Required]

Hostname as defined in zabbix ( uppercase without domain name : LEXP603 )

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the asset is located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API.

service [Required]

Windows Service name to monitor you can get this information using linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

You can use DisplayName or ServiceName as well. to retrieve service name info, run services.msc on windows prompt.

You can retrieve both DisplayNane and ServiceName using rightclick Properties on a service (for Example : DNS service : you can use either Dnscache or ‘DNS Client’)

condition [Required]

The condition to raise an alert : it’s the combination of a comparator (= or <>) and the service state ( running or stopped ) For example , to raise an alert if a service is not running, use this condition : <>running . Attention: <>stopped condition does not mean the service is running : it can be in pause or simply not present

severity [Required]

The severity can be WARNING, HIGH or DISASTER.

  • WARNING and HIGH severity : an Service Now ticket is created if a rule is correctly setup in Bemportal

  • DISASTER severity : Bangalore Call center will phone to the on duty person/team declare in ICLT

alertmessage [Optional]

This option allow to overwrite the default alert message by a custom one

This custom message must not contian spcial character and must contain from be 10 to 50 characters long

For example, a specific applicative message can be set : Kondor application is down or Service IDM is down.

instruction [Optional]

File name link to the document containing instruction to apply in case of alert .

Instructions are stored in synapes : (https://synapses.fr.world.socgen/share/Team/ITEC_PRD_SGBT/Finalized%20Zabbix/ )

Instruction must matching a filename pattern (Regexp ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+\.[A-Za-z]{3}$)

What this api does ?

Using information needed bellow, this api will create in monitoring tool :

  • item : an item will be created on the specific host and will be formatted as : [trigram] - state of service service. (for example : [GTSLU] - state of service Dnscache)

  • trigger : an trigger will be created based in this item and the condition : it will be formatted as :

    • default alert message : [APP:trigram] - state of service service condition . (for example : [APP:GTSLU] - state of service Dnscache <>running )

    • custom alert message : [APP:trigram] - alertmessage . (for example : [APP:PFOLU] - PFO Application is not available )

Note

When created , triggers are in Maintenance mode: you will have to remove this maintenance using zbx-portal site.

What information this api returns ?

In case of success, the returned information is :

{ "message": "Monitoring Service correctly created" }

delete.description:
Delete Monitoring of a Service on a Windows Host.

This api allows you to delete/remove monitoring previouly put on a specific service on host Windows machine

What input parameters this api needs ?

hostname [Required]

Hostname as defined in zabbix ( uppercase without domain name : LEXP603 )

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the asset is located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API.

id [Required]

item id corresponding to the monitored process. This information can be retrieved using ZbxPortal Site, Report -> Host PDF

As example, in the report you must get a line like : 130123 ZabAgent [PFOLU] - state of service ntd service.info[tomcat]

What this api does ?

Using information needed bellow, this api will detete in monitoring tool :

  • item : the item previouly created on the specific host (for example : [PFOLU] - state of service Tomcat)

  • trigger : the associated trigger (for example : : [APP:PFOLU] - state of service Tomcat <>running).

Note

When deleted, the activity history is also purged.

What information this api returns ?

In case of success, the returned information is :

{ "message": "Monitoring Service correctly deleted" }

Edit channel.

This api allows you to edit a MQ channel

What input parameters this api needs ?

context [Required]

Context environment of the query: can be prod or noprod

trigram [Required]

Max length (or size in megabyte) of a message that can be transmitted on the channel: 2,4,6,8,10 (often 4)
This api will edit this parameter of your specified channel

queue manager [Required]

Name of an existing queue manager


Notes: A valid input to queue manager is: not empty and only accepts A-Z0-9._ characters
Notes: The message size has to be bigger than the queue's biggest message size that it contains to work correctly

What this api does ?

Using information needed bellow, this api edit an already existing channel with the required message size and queue manager for a trigram on a specific environment context
Only the message size parameter can be edited

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this API will return a job ID

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api.

post.description:
Create a local queue.

This api allows you to create a local queue

A queue, or message queue, is a named destination to which messages can be sent.

At each creation of a queue: a queue is created and a backout queue is created.

A backout queue is a queue where messages that have failed the withdrawal threshold test are stored.

The queue name of the new local queue can't end by ".BCK".

The backout queue:

  • has the same values (queue manager, queue depth and message size) as his queue.
  • has for name: <queue name>.BCK

What input parameters this api needs ?

context [Required]

Context environment of the query: can be prod or noprod

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

queue name [Required]

Name of the new localqueue

queue manager [Required]

Queue manager of this queue

queue depth [Required]

Maximum number of messages accumulated in the queue. (Maximum: 50000)

message size [Required]

Max length (or size in megabyte) of a message that can be transmitted on the queue: 2,4,6,8,10 (often 4)


Notes: A valid input to queue name and queue manager is: not empty and only accepts A-Z0-9._ characters

What this api does ?

Using information needed bellow, this api create a local queue with the required message size, queue depth on a queue manager for a trigram on a specific environment context.

get.description:
List permissions on a queue manager.

This api allows you to list user permissions in a context-trigram-queue manager situation

What input parameters this api needs ?

context [Required]

Environment type: prod or noprod

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

queue manager [Required]

Queue manager name

Notes

  • A valid input to queue manager and queue name is: not empty and only accepts A-Z0-9._ characters
  • User have permissions "put" and "get" in a trigram, context and queue manager
  • Some "service account" can have specific permission (only "put" or "get")
  • If a user has "put" but not "get", he can't read message but he can write it
  • If a user has "get" but not "put", he can read message but he can't write it

What this api does ?

Using information needed bellow, this api list permissions of a trigram - context - queue manager.

What information this api returns ?

If success you will have this message:

{
  "queue_permissions": [
    {"permission_type": "get",
     "users": [{ "login": "user1" },
               { "login": "user2" },
               { "login": "user3" }]},
    {"permission_type": "put",
      "users": [{ "login": "user1" },
                { "login": "user2" }]}
  ]
}

post.description:
Migrate a MSSQL Database.

This api allows you to migrate a specified database to a specified server.

What input parameters this API needs ?

Payload [Required]

{ "instance_source": "string", "database_source": "string", "env_source": "string" }

name of the source instance
name of the source environement of the server
name of the source database

Instance_target [Required]

Instance of the database to migrate.

Env_target [Required]

Environement of the database to migrate.

Trigram [Required]

Trigram of the host.

What this API does ?

Using information needed, this API will migrate the specified "database_source" to the specified server "server_target".

It will :

  • Check if the database source exist
  • Check if the database source already exist on the target server
  • Export users from the destination database into a SQL file
  • Copy the source database using the last backup of the source database
  • Import the user from the SQL file generated before and login
  • Import the backup of the source database to newly created on the target server

What information this api returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS. That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this api will return a job ID. You have to verify periodically the job status using /jobs/{job_id} api.

parameters.description: name of the database to refresh
parameters.name: database_target

post.description:
Refresh a MSSQL Database.

This api allows you to refresh a specified database to a specified server.

What input parameters this API needs ?

Payload [Required]

{ "instance_source": "string", "database_source": "string", "env_source": "string", "date": "yyyymmdd", "time": "HHMMSS" }

instance source is the name of the source instance
database_source is the name of the source database
env_source is the environemet of the server_source
date is the date to refresh (format : yyyymmdd)
time is the time to refresh (format : HHMMSS)

Trigram [Required]

Trigram of the application.

Env_target [Required]

Environement of the target server.

Instance_target [Required]

Instance of the target instance.

Database_target [Required]

name of the target database.

What this API does ?

Using information needed, this API will refresh the database_target with the data of the database_source.

It will :

  • Authorize only refresh from env_source = prd to env_target != prd
  • Check if the database source and target exist
  • Check if date and time are defined
  • if only date is definied will refresh point in time at the begining of the day (date)
  • if time is defined will resfresh at the time set in (time)
  • if date is not defined or empty will refresh with the last full backup

What information this api returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS.
That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this api will return a job ID.
You have to verify periodically the job status using /jobs/{job_id} api.

post.summary: Refresh non-prod PDB with data from another non-prod PDB on the same CDB
post.description:
Refresh non-prod PDB from source to target on the same CDB and host.

This api allows you to refresh automatically from PDB source (NO PROD) to PDB target (NO PROD) .

The Refresh will take datas from source PDB at the time the API is launched.

What input parameters this api needs ?

Trigram [Required]

Trigram of Source_PDB and Target_PDB.

Both have to be in the same trigram.

Env [Required]

Environment of the target PDB

Target_PDB [Required]

Target_PDB is an Oracle Pluggable DataBase (PDB) from non-production only (use uppercase)

Tables and datas from Target_PDB will be refreshed with tables and data from Source_PDB.

The Target_PDB have to be up and running. The basic structure (schemas, ...) have to exist.

Source_PDB [Required]

Source_PDB is an Oracle Pluggable DataBase (PDB) from non-production (use uppercase) alos

Tables and datas from Source_PDB will be used for the refresh.

Tables and datas will be copied from source to target PDB at the time the API is launched.

Source_env [Required]

Environment of the source PDB

What this api does ?

Using information needed above , this api will refesh Target_PDB with all tables and datas from Source_PDB.

What information this api returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS.

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this api will return a job ID.

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api.

parameters.description: Target PDB, where data will be copied
parameters.name: target_pdb

post.summary: Refresh non-prod PDB with data from prod PDB
post.description:
Refresh Point In Time PDB from source to target.

This api allows you to refresh automatically from PDB source (PROD) to PDB target (NO PROD) .

The Refresh can be done from 30 Minutes up to 30 Days before today. (Example : TODAY=2019/01/31-12H30 --- The refresh time could be between 2019/01/31-12H and 2019/01/01-12H30)

Only if there are 30 days of backup available. All databases and datas will be replace.

What input parameters this api needs ?

Trigram [Required]

Trigram of Source_PDB and Target_PDB.

Both have to be in the same trigram.

Env [Required]

Environment of the target PDB

Target_PDB [Required]

Target_PDB is an Oracle Pluggable DataBase (PDB) from non-production only (use uppercase)

Tables and datas from Target_PDB will be refreshed with tables and data from Source_PDB.

The Target_PDB have to be up and running. The basic structure (schemas, ...) have to exist.

Source_PDB [Required]

Source_PDB is an Oracle Pluggable DataBase (PDB) from production (use uppercase)

Tables and datas from Source_PDB will be used for the refresh.

Of course, backups must have existed for at least 30 days.

Source_env [Required]

Environment of the source PDB

Date [Required]

This is the date wanted for the refresh. The format of date is YYYYMMDD

Time [Required]

This is the time wanted for the refresh. The format of time is HHMMSS

What this api does ?

Using information needed above , this api will refesh Target_PDB with all tables and datas from Source_PDB.

What information this api returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS.

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this api will return a job ID.

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api.

post.summary: Refresh non-prod PDB with data from prod PDB
post.description:
Refresh Point In Time DB from source to target.

This job allows to refresh a PDB Point in Time Recovery from a PDB on DBAAS infrastructure - using ansible .

The Refresh can be done from 30 Minutes up to 31 Days before today. (Example : TODAY=2019/01/31-12H30 --- The refresh time could be between 2019/01/31-12H and 2019/01/01-12H30)

Only if there are 30 days of backup available. All databases and datas will be replaced.

What input parameters this api needs ?

Trigram [Required]

Trigram of the Target_instance and Source_instance.

Both instances need to be in the same trigram.

Target_env [Required]

Environment of the Target_instance

Target_pdb [Required]

Target_instance is an Oracle DataBase (DB) from non-production only (use uppercase)

Tables and datas from Target_instance will be refreshed with tables and datas from Source_instance.

The Target_instance have to be up and running. The basic structure (schemas, ...) have to exist.

Source_pdb [Required]

Source_instance is an Oracle DataBase (DB) from production (use uppercase)

Tables and datas from Source_instance will be used for the refresh.

Of course, backups must have existed for at least 30 days.

Source_env [Required]

Environment of the Source_instance

Date [Required]

This is the date wanted for the refresh. The format of date is YYYYMMDD

Time [Required]

This is the time wanted for the refresh. The format of time is HHMMSS

What this api does ?

Using information needed above , this api will refesh Target_instance with all tables and datas from Source_instance.

What information this api returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS.

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this api will return a job ID.

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api.

delete.description:
Delete Oracle Instance (Database).

This API execute the Decommission of Oracle Instance (Database).

What input parameters this api needs ?

hostname [Required]

Server hostname where the database is hosted ( without domain ) . (Example: lora698)

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the asset is located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API.

instance [Required]

Database Name of which will be deleted. (Example: ABCLUD01)

What this api does ?

Decommission of Oracle Databases.

It will :

  • Remove the Database from Zabbix Monitoring;
  • Remove the Database from OEMCC;
  • Drop the Database using DBCA;
  • Remove the Database from GDAT;

What information this api returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS.

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this api will return a job ID.

You have to verify periodically the job status using /jobs/{job_id} api.

What is the Permisionning scope ?

  • API can not delete on a mutualized instance ( more than 1 trigram link to this instance in GDAT )
  • Only Noprod instance can be deleted : for Prod instance , assign a request to GTS

The AWR is used to collect performance statistics including: Wait events used to identify performance problems. Time model statistics indicating the amount of DB time associated with a process from the V$SESS_TIME_MODEL and V$SYS_TIME_MODEL views. Active Session History (ASH) statistics from the V$ACTIVE_SESSION_HISTORY view. Some system and session statistics from the V$SYSSTAT and V$SESSTAT views. Object usage statistics. Resource intensive SQL statements. This api get some information only. You recieve attach report on your email adress You could open and analyse the report with your internet browser. The interval between one date and another must be in the maximum 7 days.

What input parameters this api needs ?

Instance [Requiered]

Instance (UPPERCASE) This input will be used to determine the Oracle instance.

DateTimeStart [Optional]

The format DateTimeStart is YYYYMMDDHH (if null, automatically get date current minus 2 hours).

DateTimeEnd [Optional]

The format DateTimeEnd is YYYYMMDDHH (if null, automatically get date current minus 1 hours)

user_email [Requiered]

(The api will send the awr oracle report by mail at user_email)

What this api does ?

Using information needed, this api will:

  • Check param file about configuration connection instance
  • Test connection on the instance
  • find id report awr near your DateTimeStart parameter
  • find id report awr near your DateTimeEnd parameter
  • Show the minus and max date to get awr report
  • Check interval between one date and another must be in the maximum 7 days
  • Send oracle report by mail

What information this api returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS. That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this api will return a job ID. You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api. To get the new password, please refer to the BeAPI-DBA keepass.

get.description:
List backup cluster Postgresql.

This api allows you to list partial or all backup about cluster postgresql . WARNING We only have backup on Production cluter.

With our Backup strategy the RPO is lower than 4 hours.

To restore a database , we use a full backup and wal log files.

What input parameters this api needs ?

ClusterName [Required]

  • ClusterName (UPPERCASE) ClusterName will be used to list backup

This API will list all backups available for the chosen ClusterName. (Example : PLUXADBLUP001) or + all (lowercase) List all backup available

Date [Optional]

The Date could be used as a filter to find a Backup from a specific date time.

The format of date is YYYYMMDD.

What this api does ?

Using information needed above , this api will list all possibilities to restore or duplicate a Postgres Cluster.

What information this api returns ?

The api return "Summary backup ClusterName" and the "List of backup ClusterName".

Example about PLUXADBLUP001

Summary backup ClusterName PLUXADBLUP001

Parameter Date 20190225

Server PLUXADBLUP001:

Last archived WAL: 0000000A0000009A0000005C, at Wed Feb 27 17:30:37 2019 First available backup: 20190125T190001 Last available backup: 20190226T190001

List full backup about ClusterName PLUXADBLUP001

Parameter Date 20190225

PLUXADBLUP001 20190225T190001 - Mon Feb 25 19:00:07 2019 - Size: 161.0 MiB - WAL Size: 8.2 MiB

Test Test
Test Test
Summary backup ClusterName
Last archived WAL For a point in time restore, this Last archived WAL confirm precisely the date time that you could be restore a backup. In some limited case, this information could be wrong because this information does not indicate if a wal is missing in your time scope needs.
First available backup This information confirm the oldest full backup available. The format is YYYYMMDD HHMMSS.
Last available backup This information confirm the last full backup available. The format is YYYYMMDD HHMMSS.
List of backup ClusterName
Last archived WAL The api displays for each line the result and the availability of each complete backup. It tells you the name of the backup, the end date of the backup, the size of the files in the database, the size of the transaction logs

post.description:
Export a Postgresql dumpall .

This api allows you to export a Postgresql Dumpall.

What input parameters this api needs ?

CLustername [Requiered]

Clustername (UPPERCASE) This input will be used to determine the Target Postgresql Cluster where the dumpall will be executed.

What this api does ?

Using information needed, this api will:

  • Get information about the Postgres Cluster (Host, port,...)
  • Get connection information
  • Test connection on the Cluster
  • Execute the dumpall

The dumpall file can be used to restore a database by using the /postgres/dumps/importdumpall api. The file will have a name like : CLUSTERNAME_DATE_TIME_dumpall.sql - Example : PLUXADBLUD001_20190318_103235_dumpall.sql

What information this api returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS. That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this api will return a job ID. You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api. To get the dumpfilename you can use the /postgres/dumps/listdump api in BeAPI. This dumpfile can be used to restore a database with the /postgres/dumps/importdumpall api in BeAPI.

Refresh point in time cluster from source to target.

This api allows you to refresh automatically from cluster postgresql source (PROD) to cluster postgresql target (NO PROD) .

The Refresh can be done from 30 Minutes up to 30 Days before today. (Example : TODAY=2019/01/31-12H30 --- The refresh time could be between 2019/01/31-12H and 2019/01/01-12H30)

Only if there are 30 days of backup available. All databases and datas will be replace.

What input parameters this api needs ?

Source_ClusterName [Required]

Source_ClusterName is a cluster postgresql from production (use uppercase)

Databases and data from Source_Clustername will be used for the refresh.

Of course, backups must have existed for at least 30 days.

Target_ClusterName [Required]

Target_ClusterName is a cluster postgresql from non-production only (use uppercase)

Databases and data from Target_Clustername will be refreshed with databases and data from Source_Clustername.

The Target_ClusterName have to up and running. The basic structure (user,role and databases) have to be exist.

Date [Required]

This is the date wanted for the refresh. The format of date is YYYYMMDD

Time [Required]

This is the time wanted for the refresh. The format of time is HHMMSS

What this api does ?

Using information needed above , this api will refesh Target_ClusterName Postgres witl all databases and datas from Source_ClusterName.

Note

More in deep , this completed process includes these tasks

  • Get information connection on Source_ClusterName and Target_ClusterName
  • Save configuration file about Target_ClusterName
  • Save basic grant about Target_ClusterName
  • Stop Target_ClusterName
  • Clean all data Target_ClusterName
  • Restore basic full data Source_ClusterName to Target_ClusterName
  • Recover transaction log up to our point in time
  • Stop Target_ClusterName
  • Restore configuration file about Target_ClusterName
  • Restore basic grant about Target_ClusterName
  • Restart Target_ClusterName

What information this api returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS.

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this api will return a job ID.

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api.

post.description:
Import a Postgresql dumpall .

This api allows you to import a Postgresql Dumpall.

What input parameters this api needs ?

CLustername [Requiered]

Clustername (UPPERCASE) This input will be used to determine the Target Postgresql Cluster where the dumpall will be executed.

Dumpall File [Requiered]

Dumpall File (Format CLUSTERNAME_DATE_TIME_dumpall.sql - Example : PLUXADBLUD001_20190318_103235_dumpall.sql) To get the dumpfilename you can use the /postgres/dumps/listdump api in BeAPI. This input will be used to determine the dumpall file used for the import.

What this api does ?

Using information needed, this api will:

  • Get information about the Postgres Cluster (Host, port,...)
  • Get connection information
  • Check if the import process is not already in use
  • Apply a lock on the process
  • Prevent new connections
  • Kill all active sessions
  • Test connection on the Cluster
  • Import the dumpall file

What information this api returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS. That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this api will return a job ID. You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api.

What this api does ?

Using information needed, this api will import the dump of the database on the NOPROD Cluster you specified.

It will :

  • Check if the Cluster and database are not in production

delete.summary: Remove a Linux server from a decom state ( reanimate it )
delete.description:
Reanimate

This API allows you to Reanimate a server in a Decom state during the allowed timeframe.

What input parameters this API needs ?

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your server and correctly defined in the IAppli Referential

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the server is located.
With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, ...
For more information on available please use env API

hostname [Required]

This is the hostname of your server (without domain name : LEXP603)


What this API does ?

Using information needed above, this API will Decom a Linux server : that means the server will be shutdown and unmonitored.
After 30 days for PROD or 10 days for noProd, all alias, monitoring, data, backups, and references will be detroyed with no recovery.
During this timeframe, you can roolback your decision and reaminate it.

Note

Currently, you can not reanimate a prod server. You can reanimate a decome server durint 30 days for PROD or 10 days for noProd.

What information this API returns ?

In case of success, the returned information is:

{
  "status": "OK",
  "message": "Server <hostname> has been reanimated : it is now up, monitored and defined as active in Marley"
}

post.description:
Create Linux server

This API allows you to create a Linux server to host business or technical applications.

What input parameters this API needs ?

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the server will be located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API : to be defined

cpu [Required]

Number of cpu: [2, 4]

mem [Required]

Amount of RAM in GB:
* noprod: [2, 4] * prod: 4

disk [Required]

Size of /opt partition in GB: from 10 to 100

All applications will b installed in /opt

os [Required]

Operating system to install : redhat, redhat_8, redhat_9
Note: redhat = redhat_9

appuser [Required]

Applicative user

What this API does ?

Using information needed above , this API will create an application server on RedHAT 7 or 8, with the required cpu and RAM amount and a dedicated /opt Filesystem.

Name of this application server is formatted LtrigramNxx.domain regarding the naming convention below

  • L : for Linux

  • trigram : input trigram parameter

  • Nxx : 3 digits

    • N : 1 for Production, 2 for Support, 3 for Test ... see Env API for detailed
    • xx : incremental number

  • domain : dns domain associated to the input env parameter

For example

  • Trigram: PFOLU, env:prd => application server name = LPFOLU101.sgbt.lu
  • Trigram: ACULU, env:int => application server name = LACULU401.test.sgbt.lu
  • Trigram: MC3LU, env:uat => application server name = LMC3LU301.hom.sgbt.lu

Note

More in deep , this completed process includes these tasks

  • Register hostname in DNS
  • Store root/password entry in GTS ISO Keepass ( password compliance with sgbt rules)
  • Activate System monitoring automatically in Zabbix
  • Schedule TSM Backup only for prd env
  • Create an LDAP user Account ( based on requestor ad account )
  • Notify the resquestor by mail ( hostname and login/password information)

What information this API returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this API will return a job ID

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api.

delete.description:
Delete Linux server

This API allows you to remove a Linux server hosting business or technical applications.

What input parameters this API needs ?

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the server will be located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API : to be defined

hostname [Required]

Hostname of the Linux application server (for example : LPFOLU101.sgbt.lu)

What this API does ?

Using information needed above , this API will delete the application server. This is a destrutive action that can not be rollbacked.

Note

More in deep , this completed process includes these tasks

  • Unregister hostname in DNS
  • Remove root/password entry in GTS ISO Keepass
  • Remove System monitoring from Zabbix
  • Remove Schedule TSM Backup only for prd env

What information this API returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this API will return a job ID

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api.

trigram [Required]

env is the environment on which the server is located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API

ram [Required]

The RAM to add on the VM (1, 2 or 4 GB).

What this API does ?

The addition of RAM is only allowed up to a maximum of 16GB total and only if the operation can be done without rebooting the VM:

  • the VM must be up

  • greater than > 4GB ➞ add up to 16GB

Please send a ticket to the Linux team (gts_lux_ghs.ssb.lin) if you are stuck between 3 and 4GB."

post.summary: Move VM to Disaster or Nominal Site
post.description:
Move VM to Disaster or Nominal Site

This API allows you move a VM to Disaster or Nominal Site. It is mainly used to test unitary DRP.

What input parameters this API needs ?

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your server and correctly defined in the IAppli Referential

env [Required]

env is the environment on which the server is located. With this env comes several properties like domain, vlan, .... For more information on available please use env API

hostname [Required]

This is the hostname of your server (without domain name : LEXP603)

method [Required]

Method is related to move procedure to apply : can be

  • hot : the vm is hot moved without any shutdown.

  • cold : the vm is first shutdown, maintenance on system alerts is applied. Then the vm is moved , restarted on the other site and system maintenance is removed.

What this API does ?

Using information needed above, this API will reboot your server without any prompt. Be sure to put your server into maintenance before launching the reboot process.

What information this API returns ?

Normal operation returns http code 200 with this message

{
  "status": "ok",
  "message": "DRS rule applied. move on going to disaster site betzborf"
}

Failure operation returns http code 400 or 500 with this message :

{
  "status": "error",
  "message": "move already on going LLINLUP001 : moving to disaster"
}

    "mapper": "/dev/mapper/optVG-optLV",
    "lv_path": "/dev/optVG/optLV",
    "lv_name": "optLV",
    "pv_list": [
      {
        "pv_free": "<pv_free>",
        "pv_name": "<pv_name>",
        "pv_size": "<pv_size>",
        "pv_used": "<pv_used>",
        "vg_free_count": "<vg_free_count>",
        "vg_free": "<vg_free>"
      }
    ],
    "vg_name": "optVG",
    "lv_size": "<lv_size>",
    "vg_size": "<vg_size>"
  }
}

PS: Note that the "lvminfo" that you have with the success message is the not updated lvm infos (before your addition). If you want to see the updated infos, use the API that list LVM.

What input parameters this API needs ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this API will return a job ID

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api.

post.description:
Patch server

This API allows you to patch a server.

The patching goes like this:

  • SYS triggers are put in monitoring maintenance
  • take a VM snapshot
  • pre-check the OS (this put the OS in an adequate state to be patched)
  • patch the OS with a reboot
  • SYS triggers are removed from the monitoring maintenance

/!\ WARNING /!\ This workflow reboot the server in the OS patching step

/!\ WARNING /!\ This is the applicative team job to handle their APP triggers:

  • put them in monitoring maintenance before executing the OS patching
  • remove them from monitoring maintenance after the patching

--> this way, you can avoid useless alerts if some applications take time to restart after the server reboot

What input parameters this API needs ?

Resource parameters:

  • trigram: the trigram

  • env: the environment (example: sgna-np)

  • hostname: the server hostname (without domain)

What information this API returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this API will return a job ID

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api.

What this API does ?

Using information needed above, this API will reboot your server without any prompt. Be sure to put your server into maintenance before launching the reboot process.

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS

post.summary: Refresh non-prod instance with data from prod instance for KONDOR application
post.description:
Refresh Point In Time from source to target instance.

This api allows you to refresh automatically from source instance (PROD) to target instance (NO PROD) .

The Refresh can be done from 30 Minutes up to 30 Days before today. (Example : TODAY=2019/01/31-12H30 --- The refresh time could be between 2019/01/31-12H and 2019/01/01-12H30)

Only if there are 30 days of backup available. All databases and datas will be replace.

What input parameters this api needs ?

Trigram [Required]

Trigram of Source_instance and Target_instance.

Both have to be in the same trigram.

Env [Required]

Environment of the Target_instance.

Target_instance [Required]

Target_instance is a Sybase instance (dataserver) from non-production only (use uppercase)

Tables and datas from Target_instance will be refreshed with tables and data from Source_instance.

The Target_instance have to be up and running.

Source_instance [Required]

Source_instance is a Sybase instance (dataserver) from production (use uppercase)

Tables and datas from Source_instance will be used for the refresh.

Of course, backups must have existed for at least 30 days.

Source_env [Required]

Environment of the Source_instance.

Date [Required]

This is the date wanted for the refresh. The format of date is YYYYMMDD

Time [Required]

This is the time wanted for the refresh. Values can be : b22 (just before 10PM), an (around 2AM) or ab

Anonimization [Required]

The anonimization level. Values can be : LUX (simple anonimization) or EXT (external, big anonimization)

What this api does ?

Using information needed above , this api will refesh Target_instance with all tables and datas from Source_instance.

What information this api returns ?

This process is ASYNCHRONOUS.

That means a job will be executed in batch mode and this api will return a job ID.

You have to verify periodically the job status using jobs api.

to insert a line break)

post.summary: Onboard a application or add env to an existing application on dedicated instance
post.description:
Onboard a application or add env to XLDeploy.

This api allows you to onboard a application or add env to an existing application on dedicated instance.

What input parameters this api needs ?

trigram [Required]

Trigram linked to your application and correctly defined in IAppli Referential

env [Required]

Environnenent in XLDeploy . It can be one of

  • For NoProd : DEV DEV2 DEV3 DEV4 DEV5 TEST TEST2 TEST3 TEST4 TEST5 INT INT2 INT3 INT4 INT4 INT5
  • For Homologation : HOM HOM1 HOM2 HOM3 HOM4 HOM5 UAT UAT2 UAT3 UAT4 UAT5
  • For Support : PPRD SUP SUP1 SUP2 SUP3 SUP4 SUP5
  • For Production : PRD

These groups of env are defined as envType and 4 envTypes are actually defined :

  • For NoProd : DEV
  • For Homologation : HOM
  • For Support : SUP
  • For Production : PROD

They are needed for AD group creation

organization [Required]

Typically, ITEC department organization. (for example, RRF/REF/SDS )

application [Required]

Name of the application that will be onboarded in XLDeploy. (for example, EMIR )

What this api does ?

Using information needed bellow, this api will onboard application in XLDeploy.

The destination instance is based on the first 3 chars of organisation (for example, RRF/REF/SDS… will onboard application on XLD-RRF instance)

In XLDeploy 4 roles are created and formatted based on input parameters :

  • [application]_IMPORTER for example EMIR_IMPORTER
  • [application]_[env]_OPERATOR for example EMIR_DEV_OPERATOR
  • [application]_[env]_SYSADMIN for example EMIR_DEV_SYSADMIN
  • [application]_[env]_APPADMIN for example EMIR_DEV_APPADMIN

Permissions are granted to these roles using AD Groups which are created automatically.

  • Role IMPORTER : groups APP_[trigram]_XLD_IMPORTER for example APP_EMILU_XLD_IMPORTER
  • Role OPERATOR : groups APP_[trigram]_XLD_[envType]_OPERATOR for example APP_EMILU_XLD_DEV_OPERATOR
  • Role SYSADMIN : groups APP_[trigram]_XLD_[envType]_ADMIN for example APP_EMILU_XLD_DEV_ADMIN
  • Role APPADMIN : groups APP_[trigram]_XLD_[envType]_ADMIN for example APP_EMILU_XLD_DEV_ADMIN

What information this api returns ?

In case of success, the returned information is :

{
"message": "Application onboarded successfully"
},
{
"message": "SUCCESS : Group APP_GABLU_XLD_IMPORTER has been created"
},
{
"message": "SUCCESS : Group APP_GABLU_XLD_SUP_OPERATOR has been created"
},
{
"message": "SUCCESS : Group APP_GABLU_XLD_SUP_ADMIN has been created"
}

What is the mode of this api ?

It’s a synchronous process and takes about 60 sec to onboard an application/env

info.title: BeAPI API documentation
info.description:
BeAPI is a catalog of infrastructure and service APIs provided by GTS Luxembourg.

By using these APIs , BeAPI offers you , in your own applicative scope , the ability to manage/create by yourself, infrastructure stuff such as VirtualMachine, Database, Monitoring, Middleware, Account and so on ...

BeAPI is a Developper oriented tool : it offers API documentation with integrated test client : you can see a list of available API operations and quickly send a request in your browser to test how the API responds before writing any code of your own.

  • Find out how to get started with BeAPI : BeAPI - get Started
  • Find out how permission/authorization works : BeAPI - Permisioning Model
  • Find out how to use APIs in your scripts: BeAPI - Examples

For any question , please contact Lux-GTS-GHS-OPM team (lux.gts-ghs-opm@socgen.com)

Subscribe to NotifyNow ( BEAPI Luxembourg ) to be aware of new features
